instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041 No power - PPBUS_G3H Shorted
threads.message:
Hi all!
Customer report sudden shut off while working.
No signs of spills and no damage.
It draws 5v - 0,02A from all USB ports.
Found pure short of PPBUS_G3H (0.000 on diode mode, 0ohm). 
As you told me in an old case is safe to inject voltage to find the issue since is pure short , right?

threads.title: 820-01041 No power - PPBUS_G3H Shorted
threads.message:
Not right!

I hope you've checked for short disconnecting battery data cable first.
In fact, allow 10-20s after power is disconnected, before checking diode mode, or resistance on the MLB.

Compare short value (ohm scale) with the readings on the coils near the CPU & GPU.

threads.title: 820-01041 No power - PPBUS_G3H Shorted
threads.message:
On big coils I have 1,5ohm (with small differences between them).
pure 0,000 - 0,001 short on F7001.

threads.title: 820-01041 No power - PPBUS_G3H Shorted
threads.message:
If you are sure the short doesn't come from a secondary coil, then is safe to inject voltage.
Just in case, check the other big coils too (on entire MLB).

Remember, start with 1V and slowly increase (if needed).
Use tick cables and set PSU amp limit to max first.

threads.title: 820-01041 No power - PPBUS_G3H Shorted
threads.message:
C6455 was bad. Get warm injecting 1v in PPBUS_G3H line.
Replaced and everything works like a charm.
Thank you.
